name: Hpatoio Bitly Client
description: Guzzle service description of Bitly API

Highvalue.summary: Returns a specified number of "high-value" bitly links that are popular across bitly at this particular moment.

limit.description: The maximum number of high-value links to return.

Search.summary: Search links receiving clicks across bitly by content, language, location, and more.

limit.description: The maximum number of links to return.

offset.description: Which result to start with (defaults to 0)

lang.description: Favor results in this language (two letter ISO code).

cities.description: Show links active in this city (ordered like country-state-city, e.g. us-il-chicago).

domain.description: Restrict results to this web domain (like bitly.com).

full_domain.description: Restrict results to this full web domain (like blog.bitly.com)

fields.description: which fields to return in the response (comma-separated). May be any of: domain, initial_epoch, h2, h3, site, lastindexed, keywords, last_indexed_epoch, title, initial, summaryText, content, score, summaryTitle, type, description, cities, lang, url, referrer, aggregate_link, lastseen, page, ogtitle, aggregate_link. By default, all will be returned

RealtimeBursting_phrases.summary: Returns phrases that are receiving an uncharacteristically high volume of click traffic, and the individual links (hashes) driving traffic to pages containing these phrases

RealtimeHot_phrases.summary: Returns phrases that are receiving a consistently high volume of click traffic, and the individual links (hashes) driving traffic to pages containing these phrases

RealtimeClickrate.summary: Returns the click rate for content containing a specified phrase

phrase.description: The phrase for which you'd like to get the click rate

LinkInfo.summary: Returns metadata about a single bitly link

LinkContent.summary: Returns the “main article” from the linked page, as determined by the content extractor, in either HTML or plain text format

content_type.description: specifies whether to return the content as html or plain text (default: html).

LinkCategory.summary: Returns the detected categories for a document, in descending order of confidence

LinkSocial.summary: Returns the "social score" for a specified bitly link. Note that the social score are highly dependent upon activity (clicks) occurring on the bitly link. If there have not been clicks on a bitly link within the last 24 hours, it is possible a social score for that link does not exist.

LinkLocation.summary: Returns the significant locations for the bitly link or None if locations do not exist. Note that locations are highly dependent upon activity (clicks) occurring on the bitly link. If there have not been clicks on a bitly link within the last 24 hours, it is possible that location data for that link does not exist.

LinkLanguage.summary: Returns the significant languages for the bitly link. Note that languages are highly dependent upon activity (clicks) occurring on the bitly link. If there have not been clicks on a bitly link within the last 24 hours, it is possible that language data for that link does not exist.

Expand.summary: Given a bitly URL or hash (or multiple), returns the target (long) URL.

shortUrl.description: Refers to one or more bitly links. e.g.: http://bit.ly/1RmnUT or http://j.mp/1RmnUT.

hash.description: Refers to one or more bitly hashes. e.g.: 2bYgqR or a-custom-name.

Info.summary: This is used to return the page title for a given bitly link.

hash.description: Refers to one or more bitly hashes. e.g.: 2bYgqR or a-custom-name.

shortUrl.description: Refers to one or more bitly links e.g.: http://bit.ly/1RmnUT or http://j.mp/1RmnUT.

expand_user.description: Optional true|false - include extra user info in response.

LinkLookup.summary: This is used to query for a bitly link based on a long URL.

url.description: One or more long URLs to lookup.

Shorten.summary: Given a long URL, returns a bitly short URL.

longUrl.description: A long URL to be shortened (example: http://iliveinperego.com/).

domain.description: refers to a preferred domain; either bit.ly, j.mp, or bitly.com, for users who do NOT have a custom short domain set up with bitly.

UserLink_edit.summary: Changes link metadata in a user's history.

link.description: The bitly link to be edited

title.description: Optional - The title of this bitmark.

note.description: Optional - A description of, or note about, this bitmark.

private.description: Optional - Boolean true or false indicating privacy setting (defaults to user-level setting).

user_ts.description: Optional - Timestamp as an integer epoch.

archived.description: Optional - Boolean true or false indicating whether or not link is to be archived.

edit.description: A comma separated string of fields to be edited. ie: to edit the note field you also need to pass edit=note.

UserLink_lookup.summary: This is used to query for a bitly link shortened by the authenticated user based on a long URL.

url.description: One or more long URLs to lookup.

UserLink_save.summary: Saves a link as a bitmark in a user's history, with optional pre-set metadata. (Also returns a short URL for that link.)

longUrl.description: The URL to be saved as a bitmark.

title.description: Optional - The title of this bitmark.

note.description: Optional - A description of, or note about, this bitmark.

private.description: Optional - Boolean true or false indicating privacy setting (defaults to user-level setting).

user_ts.description: Optional - Timestamp as an integer epoch.

UserSave_custom_domain_keyword.summary: Save a custom keyword for a custom short domain. This endpoint is only available to paid customers.

keyword_link.description: The short domain and keyword combination

target_link.description: The bitly short URL the specified keyword will map to

overwrite.description: Optional - Boolean true or false indicating whether or not to overwrite existing entry if one exists (defaults to false).

unit.description: minute, hour, day, week or month, default: day | Note: when unit is minute the maximum value for units is 60.

units.description: an integer representing the time units to query data for. Pass -1 to return all units of time.

timezone.description: An integer hour offset from UTC (-14 to 14), or a timezone string default: America/New_York.

unit_reference_ts.description: An epoch timestamp, indicating the most recent time for which to pull metrics, default: now. Note: the value of unit_reference_ts rounds to the nearest unit. Note: historical data is stored hourly beyond the most recent 60 minutes. If a unit_reference_ts is specified, unit cannot be minute.

LinkClicks.summary: Returns the number of clicks on a single bitly link.

rollup.description: True or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

LinkCountries.summary: Returns metrics about the countries referring click traffic to a single bitly link.

my_network.description: true or false - restrict to my network.

subaccounts.description: Only available to enterprise accounts. true or false - restrict to this enterprise account and its subaccounts

limit.description: Integer in the range of 1 to 25 that specifies the number of records to return (default: 10).

expand_user.description: true or false - include display names of encoders.

LinkEncoders.summary: Returns users who have encoded this link (optionally only those in the requesting user's social graph).

LinkEncoders_by_count.summary: Returns users who have encoded this link (optionally only those in the requesting user's social graph), sorted by the number of clicks on each encoding user's link. Note: The response will only contain users whose links have gotten at least one click, and will not contain any users whose links are private.

LinkEncoders_count.summary: Returns the number of users who have shortened (encoded) a single bitly link.

LinkReferrers.summary: Returns metrics about the pages referring click traffic to a single bitly link.

LinkReferrers_by_domain.summary: Returns metrics about the pages referring click traffic to a single bitly link.

LinkReferring_domains.summary: Returns metrics about the pages referring click traffic to a single bitly link.

unit.description: minute, hour, day, week or month, default: day | Note: when unit is minute the maximum value for units is 60.

units.description: an integer representing the time units to query data for. Pass -1 to return all units of time.

timezone.description: An integer hour offset from UTC (-14 to 14), or a timezone string default: America/New_York.

unit_reference_ts.description: An epoch timestamp, indicating the most recent time for which to pull metrics, default: now. Note: the value of unit_reference_ts rounds to the nearest unit. Note: historical data is stored hourly beyond the most recent 60 minutes. If a unit_reference_ts is specified, unit cannot be minute.

UserClicks.summary: Returns the aggregate number of clicks on all of the authenticated user's bitly links.

rollup.description: true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

UserCountries.summary: Returns aggregate metrics about the countries referring click traffic to all of the authenticated user's bitly links.

rollup.description: true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

UserPopular_earned_by_clicks.summary: Returns the top links to your tracking domain (or domains) created by users not associated with your account, ordered by clicks. Users can register a tracking domain from their bitly settings page. This endpoint is only available to paid customers.

domain.description: A tracking domain as returned from /v3/user/tracking_domain_list.

UserPopular_earned_by_shortens.summary: Returns the top links to your tracking domain (or domains) created by users not associated with your account, ordered by shortens. Users can register a tracking domain from their bitly settings page. This endpoint is only available to paid customers.

domain.description: A tracking domain as returned from /v3/user/tracking_domain_list.

UserPopular_links.summary: Returns the authenticated user's most-clicked bitly links (ordered by number of clicks) in a given time period. Note: This replaces the realtime_links endpoint.

UserPopular_owned_by_clicks.summary: Returns the top links to your tracking domain (or domains) created by you or your subaccounts ordered by clicks. Users can register a tracking domain from their bitly settings page. This endpoint is only available to paid customers..

domain.description: A tracking domain as returned from /v3/user/tracking_domain_list.

subaccount.description: Restrict to links created by this subaccount (may be specified multiple times).

UserPopular_owned_by_shortens.summary: Returns the top links to your tracking domain (or domains) created by you or your subaccounts ordered by number of shortens. Users can register a tracking domain from their bitly settings page. This endpoint is only available to paid customers.

domain.description: A tracking domain as returned from /v3/user/tracking_domain_list.

subaccount.description: Restrict to links created by this subaccount (may be specified multiple times).

UserReferrers.summary: Returns aggregate metrics about the pages referring click traffic to all of the authenticated user's bitly links.

rollup.description: true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

UserReferring_domains.summary: Returns aggregate metrics about the domains referring click traffic to all of the authenticated user's bitly links.

rollup.description: true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

UserShare_counts.summary: Returns the number of shares by the authenticated user in a given time period.

rollup.description: true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

UserShare_counts_by_share_type.summary: Returns the number of shares by the authenticated user, broken down by share type (ie: twitter, facebook, email) in a given time period.

rollup.description: true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.

UserShorten_counts.summary: Returns the number of links shortened (encoded) in a given time period by the authenticated user.

rollup.description: true or false. Return data for multiple units rolled up to a single result instead of a separate value for each period of time.
